scenarioDescription:
The HR 810 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HR 810 is a star with 1.34 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.13 times its radius. It is located 56.48 light years away from the solar system.

HR 810 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HR 810 system


HR 810 b

HR 810 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2000-01, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.92 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HR 810 b is 721.860 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HR 810 b is 13.300 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HR 810 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HR 810, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the La Silla Observatory.
name: HR 810 - System With 1 Exoplanet
